p: Scientific and ethical approval was obtained from Kenya Medical Research Institute Scientific and Ethics Review Unit (KEMRI-SERU) (Project Number SERU 2787). The animal use component was reviewed and approved (approval number KEMRI/ACUC/ 03.03.14) by the KEMRI Animal Use and Care committee (KEMRI ACUC). The KEMRI ACUC adheres to national guidelines on the care and use of animals in research and education in Kenya enforced by National Commission for Science, Technology and Innovation (NACOSTI). The Institute has a foreign assurance identification number F16-00211 (A5879-01) from the Office of Laboratory Animal Welfare (OLAW) under the Public Health Service and commits to the International Guiding Principles for Biomedical Research Involving Animals.
